metadata.Title: CVE-2015-5300 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The panic_gate check in NTP before 4.2.8p5 is only re-enabled after the first change to the system clock that was greater than 128 milliseconds by default, which allows remote attackers to set NTP to an arbitrary time when started with the -g option, or to alter the time by up to 900 seconds otherwise by responding to an unspecified number of requests from trusted sources, and leveraging a resulting denial of service (abort and restart).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-5300` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ntp - 1:4.2.6.p5+dfsg-3ubuntu2.14.04.5
ntpdate - 1:4.2.6.p5+dfsg-3ubuntu2.14.04.5
No subscription required

advisory.DiscoveredBy: Aanchal Malhotra, Isaac E. Cohen, and Sharon Goldberg

notes.Note: mdeslaur> as of 2015-10-22, not yet fixed upstream patch in redhat bug, but improved patch in comment #3 is restricted

criterions.comment: ntp package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:4.2.6.p5+dfsg-3ubuntu2.14.04.5').
